titlestmt.subtitle: Papers, 1932-2012, of the National Theatre Conference at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlestmt.author: Electronic finding aid encoded by Donald C. Force.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:10:18 -0500.

change.item: A couple editorial changes made to the Biographical Note, as well as the Scope and Content Note.
Updated to schema and added Series IX. Additions.
Batch update to change subject links.
Finding aid enhancement project. Kyra Triebold

did.abstract: The National Theatre Conference mss., 1932-2012, consist of the papers of past presidents, executive secretary, and treasurer of the National Theatre Conference, an organization of American community and university theatres organized collectively to serve non-commercial theatre.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], National Theatre Conference mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The National Theatre Conference is a professional association of directors of American community and university theatres organized collectively to serve the non-commercial theatre. It was established in 1931 at a conference at Northwestern University. As of 2010, membership is restricted to 150 members.
For more information on the National Theatre Conference see Balio, Tino. The History of the National Theatre Conference. [n.p.], 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Consists of the papers of past presidents, executive secretary, and treasurer of the National Theatre Conference. They consist of the files of Barclay Spencer Leatham, 1900-1981, educator, from the central office and the correspondence of past presidents: Paul Baker, 1911-2009, theatre director; Gilmore Brown, 1886?-1960, theatre director; Paul Eliot Green, 1894-1981, playwright; Frederic Charles McConnell, 1890-1968, theatre director; Lee Roy Norvelle, 1892-1984, professor; Scott Jackson Parker, 1945- , theatre manager; and, Theodore Albert Viehman, 1889-1970 , theatre director. The papers of past president Sawyer Falk, 1898-1961, educator, are in the possession of the Syracuse University Library.

The collection was further enriched by David Harrison Stevens, 1884-1968 , educator, who donated a bound set of the National Theatre Conference Bulletin and a complete report of all grants made in theatre and drama by the Rockefeller Foundation; by Alexander Wyckoff, 1898-1995, actor, who sent his files of valuable information on the early history of the National Theatre Conference; by Frederic Charles McConnell's correspondence as treasurer and head of the fellowship project; and by Mrs. Hallie (Ferguson) Flanagan Davis, 1890-1969, dramatist, who sent her correspondence as chairman of the New Playwright Project.

Also included are papers pertaining to the Appraisal Project conducted by the National Theatre Conference, 1958-1965, and material dealing with dissertations, papers and replies to a questionnaire from members of the organization, 1945-1964.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Correspondence; II. Community Theatre; III. University Theatre; IV. Placement Service; V. Conferences/meetings; VI. Miscellaneous; VII. Notebooks; VIII. Papers of past officers; and IX. Additions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by various officers of the National Theatre Conference.

did.unittitle: Baker, Paul:; 1959 program; ; 1960 program; 1960-1961 meeting; ; (7 folders)
Brown, Gilmore: Correspondence, A-Z (4 folders); letters sent to all members; Membership files (26ff); election and membership data
Falk, Sawyer: correspondence (3 folders); photocopies - "originals in Syracuse University Library (4 folders)
Green, Paul: correspondence (8 folders); general; wartime programs; Fort Bragg project; war writing; war service; soldier theatricals reports

McConnell, Frederick: Alphabetical files - A; ANTA-May writing project; Army play project; B; Bulletin, (8 folders); C; Coburn, C.; conference booklet; D-F (3 folders); Falk, S.; fellowship (3 folders); Freedley

McConnell, Frederick (cont.): Alphabetical files - G; Gorelick; H; income tax exemptions; incorporation; J-L (3 folders); Leathem; Mc; meetings, (5 folders); membership; N; New York tryout studio; new play project; placement service catalog; professional theatre policy; publication project; regional conferences; Rockefeller Foundation; R; S; Seldon; Stanford University; Stein; Stevens; T; touring company; trustees; U-W; The Wind is Ninety; X-Z; (4 folders)
Norvelle, Lee: Acquisition of papers for history of NTC (4 folders); general, (2 folders); membership (2 folders); New Play project
Norvelle, Lee (cont.): Placement Service; tryout studios, New York; Ways and Means Committee (2 folders); general correspondence, (11 folders)
Norvelle Touring Company: bookings (6 folders); financial (3 folders); general, ; publicity, (2 folders); purchase requisitions (3 folders); royalties; talent

Parker, Scott Jackson: President; vice-President (Sidney Berger); Treasurer (Kevin Maifeld); Secretary (Gresdna Doty); agendas; annual meeting programs; archives - includes copy of The History of the National Theatre Conference, by Tino Balio and Lee Norvelle (National Theatre Conference); Board of Trustees handbook; code of regulations; correspondence and reference materials; luncheon; membership booklet; membership lists; minutes; newsletter; outstanding achievement award; Paul Green Award; Person of the Year; The Players; SWOT analysis; Stavis Award (2 folders)
Viehman, Theodore: general (5 folders); appraisal; constitution, by-laws, codes

Viehman, Theodore (cont.): ANTA (American National Theatre and Academy) (3 folders); AETA (American Educational Theatre Assoc.)/ACTA (American Community Theatre Assoc.); National Council of the Arts in Education; printed materials
National Theatre Conference Quarterly Bulletin: Apr. 1939, Oct. 1942, June 1943
National Theatre Conference Bulletin: May 1945, Nov. 1945, Mar. 1946, Oct. 1946, Apr. 1947, Oct. 1947, Apr. 1948, July 1948, Nov. 1948 (2), Dec. 1949 (2), Mar. 1950, June 1950, Nov. 1950 (3 folders)
Bound volumes: General Education Board: Directory of Fellowship Awards for the Years, 1922-1950 [and] The Rockefeller Foundation: Directory of Fellowship Awards for the Years 1917-1950
